description: From French fricassée (noun), from fricassée, past participle of fricasser (verb).

entries.meaning: Meat or poultry cut into small pieces, stewed or fried and served in its own gravy.

verbs.description: fricassee (third-person singular simple present fricassees, present participle fricasseeing, simple past and past participle fricasseed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, cooking) To cook meat or poultry in this manner.
